actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Regulatory Reform.

official_title: A bill to provide access to small businesses and other persons, of information concerning rules applicable to such businesses or persons.
short_title: Small Business Regulatory Information Act of 1981

summary.text: Small Business Regulatory Information Act of 1981 - Requires each executive agency to publish in the Federal Register the standard industrial classification (SIC) code for the industry to which each newly proposed or promulgated rule applies. Directs the Director of the Federal Register to establish in the Office of the Federal Register a Small Business Information Center which, upon request, shall provide a listing of the rules which apply to industries within a specified SIC. Requires each agency to amend all of its rules to include the appropriate SIC codes within five years.

titles.title: Small Business Regulatory Information Act of 1981
A bill to provide access to small businesses and other persons, of information concerning rules applicable to such businesses or persons.
